text:
:champagne: _You have opened a new, empty shared channel._ 
_Share <https://www.smooz.io/room/5ddbd5c45672990004ca30e6|this link> with other teams to invite them in it_
<@U4VR52RQE> has renamed the channel from "z-shared-25" to "luis-nicolas-and-elizabeth"
name: luis-nicolas-and-elizabeth

text:
Hey Elizabeth, please meet Luis Nicolas your incredible E-Mentor we've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message me if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Elizabeth, I'm Nico , been working as a vfx compositor for Framestore for a while, biased towards what they are now calling visdev, meaning making innovative effects look good for the client's needs. Will be happy to discuss anything regarding work in vfx and give advice for your portfolio :)

Hi Nico! I'm currently in my final year of Uni at Bournemouth. Most of my units this year are going to be focused on effects so having your feedback/advice would be really cool! Can I ask how you started out in the Vfx industry?

Sure. It's a weird one, I seem to be in a sandwich generation of vfx artists; between the old school people that studied art or engineering and those that studied actual vfx carriers in uni. I studied multimedia engineering, back in Colombia, it was a new program as a bit of a mess; by the end of it, I kinda only learned how to use Maya and got an internship in an advertisement post-production house. After a year of being a generalist, I jumped into comp, and been downloaded by that since then. At some point Framestore was doing 47 Ronin and were desperate to grow their comp department, so I was lucky enough to be snatched away from Colombia. I have a bit of computer graphics/math/programming background thanks to the engineering side of my career, so that's helped me be a missing link between FX and comp, which has been the main thing I've been doing for the last 7 years or so.
Let me know what you need feedback/advice on, will be happy to help!
